intro: Eschscholzia douglasii var. tenuifolia, commonly known as the slenderstem poppy, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Papaveraceae family, characterized by its showy, cup-shaped flowers that range in color from orange to red. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. Its leaves are narrow and linear, and it produces capsule fruits that contain numerous small, wind-dispersed seeds. This variety is distinguished by its slender stems and smaller, more delicate flowers compared to other Eschscholzia species.
